content: for our heel so good news we don t have to knit the heel and just skip it in the next round work 24 sts in stockinette stitch and then cast on 28 new sts the extra 4 sts allow for a little bit extra room for our heel from now on we will work the top of the sock in stockinette stitch and the bottom in 1 x 1 ribbing * in the next round work 24 sts in stockinette stitch and then 28 sts in 1 x 1 ribbing * repeat from * to * another 3 times we will now start to decrease the 28 sts in ribbing to 24 sts so that we arrive at our initial stitch count do the following round 1 work 23 sts in stockinette stitch then sks work the remaining stitches of the round in 1 x 1 ribbing until there is one stitch left in the round then k2tog with the first stitch of the next round place the stitch marker before the stitches you knit together round 2 work one round without decreases where you knit the knit sts and purl the purl sts repeat round 1 and round 2 one more time you now have 48 sts on your needles continue working the foot until it measures approximately 8 cm or until you reached your desired length work the top of the sock in stockinette stitch and the bottom in 1 x 1 ribbing finish off the sock with 4 rounds in 1 x 1 ribbing before binding off with an elastic bind-off method apply the same instructions to work the second sock and you re done i really hope you like your new yoga socks and that you enjoyed the knitting process if you share pictures of your knitting process or the finished piece on instagram please feel free to use the hashtags #janneyogasocks and #quasigerade so that i can find and admire your work thank you so so much for choosing my pattern and supporting my work if there are any questions do not hesitate to write me an e-mail at quasigerade@web de happy knitting
